story.title: 2012 Chicago City Council Ward Remap
story.description: A time line of the ward remapping vote where Chicago Aldermen passed the wrong ward map. As of this writing there has been no follow up legislation passed to amend the borders. In my opinion this was a big failure of the entire Chicago City Council and virtually the entire Chicago media.

author.name: Josh Kalov
author.bio: Fan of education, politics, better government, open source software, sports, & most things peanut butter related.

data.text: January 19, 2012: Chicago City Council Votes on the Ward Remap

quote.text: Many comments re: lack of transparency in this #remap. Contact your Alderman and let them know what you think. http://bit.ly/iq9GqB

meta.text: Many comments re: lack of transparency in this #remap. Contact your Alderman and let them know what you think. http://t.co/nrviztwJ

user.name: Chicago City Clerk
user.description: Welcome to the official Twitter account for the Office of the Chicago City Clerk. Follow us to learn about our services, events and City Council proceedings.

quote.text: 8 Ald. Voted No, Vote Count and Map to be posted ASAP on chicityclerk LIC RT @RoderickTSawyer: I voted No on the map 41-8 #ChiCouncil

user.name: Alderman Danny Solis
user.description: Alderman of the 25th Ward and Chairman of the Committee on Zoning, Landmarks and Building Standards

data.text: The City Clerk's Office Posts the PDF of the passed legislation. I was living in the 44th ward at the time and knew I was near a ward border in several of the drafts so I immediately went to the legal description to see where I was:

quote.text: It's up! Find new ward #remap we received here http://bit.ly/wgZxrt #chicouncil

meta.text: It's up! Find new ward #remap we received here http://t.co/R9XKGCU3 #chicouncil

data.text: I find a minor east/west mistake in the legal description. Annoying, but not uncommon.

quote.text: There is at least one place in the 44th ward legal description that says "east" when it almost definitely should say "west." #remap

meta.text: There is at least one place in the 44th ward legal description that says "east" when it almost definitely should say "west." #remap

user.name: Steven Vance
user.description: Bicycling as transportation, GIS, blogging about Chicago (and sometimes other places). Really good at bike parking consulting, heh.

image.caption: Today, the City Council voted in favor of a new

meta.description: Today, the City Council voted in favor of a new redistricting map. I voted in favor because I believed it will keep the 44th Ward close to what it has traditionally been. These are the boundaries that I voted for today. The Clerk's Office will be amending the description to fit these borders.
meta.title: Today, the City Council voted in favor of a new

data.text: The image of the map of the "new" 44th ward posted by Alderman Tunney's Office showed a clear difference in boundaries from the legal descriptions. Confused, I begin to inquire...

quote.text: @stevevance @JQuesterman @SethLavin @derek_eder @kylehillman Its wrong.

meta.text: @stevevance @JQuesterman @SethLavin @derek_eder @kylehillman Its wrong.

data.text: Alderman Tunney's Office claims that he voted on the boundaries despite them not being in the legislation.

quote.text: "These are the boundaries that I voted for today. The Clerk's Office will be amending the description to fit these borders." - @AldTomTunney

meta.text: "These are the boundaries that I voted for today. The Clerk's Office will be amending the description to fit these borders." - @AldTomTunney

meta.text: @shua123 text in ordinance doesn't all match the actual map, will likely be amended at Feb mtng. Go by map, not text is what we were told.

user.name: Chicago City Clerk
user.description: Welcome to the official Twitter account for the Office of the Chicago City Clerk. Follow us to learn about our services, events and City Council proceedings.

data.text: The City Clerk's Office corrects Alderman Tunney's Office regarding the need for amending. The city clerk cannot in fact just go and change legislation.

quote.text: Need to b amended @ Council mtng, we can't change RT @shua123: @AldTomTunney claiming bound dif than text #remap clarify @chicityclerk ?

meta.text: Need to b amended @ Council mtng, we can't change RT @shua123: @AldTomTunney claiming bound dif than text #remap clarify @chicityclerk ?

data.text: July 24, 2012: Legislation to amend the Ward Remap legal descriptions is finally introduced.

link.title: Six months later, Chicago aldermen to clean up ward map mistakes
link.description: In January, the city council signed off on new boundaries for Chicago’s wards. But the mapmakers had been up the whole night before...

attribution.title: Six months later, Chicago aldermen to...
attribution.name: Wbez

meta.description: In January, the city council signed off on new boundaries for Chicago’s wards. But the mapmakers had been up the whole night before tinkering and making adjustments to appease aldermen. That meant some of the legal descriptions for the wards were off, inaccurate, wrong.
meta.title: Six months later, Chicago aldermen to clean up ward map mistakes

link.title: Office of the City Clerk - Document #: O2012-5439

meta.text: Item #3 on #chicouncil Rules agenda was proposed ord amending City ward boundaries. Deferred.

user.name: Chicago City Clerk
user.description: Welcome to the official Twitter account for the Office of the Chicago City Clerk. Follow us to learn about our services, events and City Council proceedings.

data.text: August 10, 2012: The first article about voter registration notices using the "new" wards. The Chicago Tribune article does not mention that the "real" remap still has not been voted on. Alderman Moreno tweets a link to the article. My follow up question to him regarding the correct remap borders goes unanswered.

quote.text: This is still being worked out, but I'll keep you informed... http://ow.ly/cT0nX via @chicagotribune #Remap

meta.text: This is still being worked out, but I'll keep you informed... http://t.co/xMIM1rkC via @chicagotribune #Remap

user.name: Alderman Joe Moreno
user.description: I was sworn in as the Alderman of Chicago’s 1st Ward (the best one) on March 26, 2010. On 2.22.11, I received 74% of the vote to retain this position.

link.title: Voter registration notices with new wards could trigger territory tussles among some aldermen
link.description: Nearly a quarter of Chicago's 1.3 million voters will find themselves in a new ward when voter registration cards arrive in the mail soon...

attribution.title: Voter registration notices with new w...
attribution.name: Chicagotribune

meta.description: Nearly a quarter of Chicago's 1.3 million voters will find themselves in a new ward when voter registration cards arrive in the mail soon, a shift that could affect residents and businesses looking for a zoning change, permit or other city service.
meta.title: Voter registration notices with new wards could trigger territory tussles among some aldermen

quote.text: @Alderman_Moreno has the board even passed the "correct" #remap borders yet?

meta.text: @Alderman_Moreno has the board even passed the "correct" #remap borders yet?
